clinical_study.brief_title: Validation of a Proteomic Signature and Assessment of Viremia in Children With Fever Without Source
clinical_study.official_title: Which Virus Leads to Viremia in Children With Fever Without Source and do New Biomarkers Correlate With Viral and Bacterial Infections?

brief_summary.textblock: The study is an observational blinded Validation study in pediatric patients below 3 years old with a diagnosis of Fever Without Source (FWS). In this study the investigators aim to validate the performance of a proteomic signature aiding the physicians to discriminate between viral and bacterial infections in febrile children. The study will also assess the prevalence of Human Enteroviruses (HEV), Human Parechoviruses (HPeV), Adenovirus (AdV) and Human Herpesvirus type 6 (HHV-6) viremia, as well as Kingella Kingae bacteremia in the study cohort.

primary_outcome.measure: Diagnostic performance of a proteomic signature for discriminating between viral and bacterial infections in children aged three months to three years presenting with fever without source
primary_outcome.time_frame: 0-7 days after the initiation of symptoms
primary_outcome.description: Sensitivity, Specificity, Positive predictive value and negative predictive value of the test for discriminating viral from bacterial infection in the study cohort

secondary_outcome.measure: Diagnostic performance of a proteomic signature for discriminating between viral and bacterial infections in children under three months of age
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-7 days after the initiation of symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Sensitivity, Specificity, Positive predictive value and negative predictive value of the test for discriminating viral from bacterial infection in the study cohort

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of Human Enteroviruses, Human Parechoviruses, Adenovirus and Human Herpesvirus type 6 viremia, as well as K. kingae bacteremia in children under three years old presenting with fever without source
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-7 days after the initiation of symptoms

arm_group.description: Clinical diagnosis of FWS (fever of less than 7 days with no cause determined by the history and the physical exam).
Children visiting the hospital due to a non-infectious, non inflammatory etiology

study_pop.textblock: Pediatric patients below three years old which were presented with a diagnosis of fever without source to the emergency room in the Children's Hospital, Geneva University Hospitals

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of FWS (fever of less than 7 days with no cause determined by the history or the physical exam)
- Age < 3 years old
- Informed consent (IC) given by parent or legal guardian
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unavailable blood
- Comorbidities predisposing to infections such as cancer, primary or secondary immunodeficiency, and iatrogenic immunosuppression
Inclusion Criteria for healthy controls:
- Age < 3 years old
- Informed consent (IC) given by parent or legal guardian
- No suspicion of infectious or inflammatory disease at presentation and during the two weeks before.
